column1: A chalazion is a small bump in the eyelid caused by a blockage of a tiny oil gland.
The gland will form a firm nodule in the eyelid that is not tender.
Rarely, skin cancer of the eyelid may look like a chalazion.
Rarely, a chalazion will heal by itself but may leave a scar on the eyelid.
Call your health care provider if lumps on the eyelid continue to get bigger despite treatment, or you have an area of eyelash loss.
